nodes.bodyText: We should rename this variable to contract or something.
We should probably replace code for result in this assertion msg.
I'd like to see a more descriptive name in this test. Something like memberCanBeAddedAfterBeingRemoved or something similar.
I don't think VALUE_WHILE_BOB_MEMBER and VALUE_WHILE_BOB_REMOVED need to be class-level constants. They can be local variables.

It would be good to use the "concise" version of this.
lockPrivacyGroup(privacyGroupId, alice);

Same here, it would be good to use the "concise" version:
addMembersToPrivacyGroup(privacyGroupId, alice, bob);

This seems to be repeated pattern in this test.

Change the contract value
Check the expected value for members.

Any chance that we can encapsulate this logic into a method and reuse across this test? It should make the test more readable.
Something like:
changeContractValueAndCheck(privacyGroupId, contract, members, expectedValue);
Maybe this should be a debug or trace level?

I feel like if we move this logic into its own class (e.g. PrivateTransactionRehydrationSelector (or something with a better name) we could have multiple unit tests to guarantee the different possible logical paths.
And the unit tests could help one understand the different scenarios.
Maybe we don't do it now, but it would be a good thing.

I think there is some rehydration code in the DefaultPrivacyController as well!
I think we could have a class that contains a lot of that rehydration code, like creation of the blob, creating this list ...
I think we should do that when we are doing the refactor of EeaSendRawTransaction ...
